item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: All Pop-Up Camp Locations In Scarlet Forest
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds introduces a vast, ever-changing world where players must adapt to dynamic weather conditions and shifting ecosystems while tracking formidable monsters. With an emphasis on exploration and survival, the game enhances traversal mechanics, allowing hunters to seamlessly navigate diverse terrains using mounts and advanced movement tools.

Pop-Up Camps in Monster Hunter Wilds act as portable resting spots where players can cook meals, change equipment, and craft items using the item box. They also function as Fast-Travel points, making it easier to reach monsters or resources. Here are all the locations of Pop-Up Camps in Scarlet Forest .

All Scarlet Forest Pop-Up Camp Locations in Monster Hunter Wilds

There are nine Pop-Up Camps in Scarlet Forest , and some of them require the player to uncover hidden locations within the areas. Keep in mind that players can only set up four Pop-Up Camps in a region at a time . Some locations are dangerous, meaning that Large Monsters might roam around and destroy them. This makes choosing camp locations important in order to avoid wasting Guild Points on constant repairs.

Players can customize their Pop-Up Camps by talking to Tek , an NPC. You can change both the primary and secondary colors of your tent and add gear and other decorations around the camp.

Area 6: Flowering Rocks Camp

  • Safety Level: Safe

For this Pop-Up Camp you need to ride to Area 6 where you can find a narrow entrance into the trees at the southeast part of the of the area . Head through this narrow pathway to reach a mini area with a Pop-Up Camp at the end. The camp costs 25 Guild Points to set up and has Fire Herb and Flowfern nearby if you need these resources.

Area 7: Bower of the Great Tree Camp

  • Safety Level: Dangerous

This camp should be very easy to find, and you might have already discovered it while riding during your main missions. The camp is west of Area 7 in a somewhat clear area . However, setting up camp here costs 75 Guild Points because this area is quite dangerous, with monsters frequently roaming around. You can find Slashberry and Stones to the right of the camp on the map.

Area 8: Underground Lake Camp

  • Safety Level: Safe

To reach this Pop-Up Camp, ride to Area 8 on your map and look north . You'll spot a waterfall—head toward it to reveal a hidden underground area behind it. You can set up camp here for 25 Guild Points . This location has plenty of Mining Outcrops and is one of the best spots to farm Platinum and Golden Fish, which can earn you a lot of Guild Points.

Area 8: South Camp

  • Safety Level: Dangerous

This camp is easy to locate. Although listed under Area 8, it’s slightly east of the Area 7 marker on the map . Setting up camp here costs 75 Guild Points , and it's a great spot to farm Parashroom and Mandragora . Parashrooms are essential for crafting lure and trap items to help capture large monsters.

Area 10: Southwest Camp

  • Safety Level: Dangerous

Area 10 is northwest of Area 6 and has plenty of Wedge Beetles to collect. Heading further west, you'll find a climbable spot leading to the Southwest Pop-Up Camp. A Bonepile is located nearby, and setting up camp here costs 75 Guild Points .

Area 12: Northeast Camp

  • Safety Level: Insecure

This camp is hidden east of Area 12 in a small riverside spot . You can reach it by heading east from Area 10 or north from Area 8 via a tree vine path . Setting up camp here costs 50 Guild Points , and you can find Blue Mushroom and Flashbugs nearby.

Area 14: Southwest Camp

  • Safety Level: Dangerous

Area 14 is one of the areas that you might not come across, as it's not on a route for most main and optional missions. Go to Area 13 and look east to find a climbable wall . From here, keep going up the path , and you will discover Area 14 with a Pop-Up Camp to the left . You will need to spend 75 Guild Points if you want to set up camp here, and you can also find these items:

  • Blastnut
  • Nulberry
  • Leaflugger Ant
  • Godbug

Area 17: Great Lake Shore Camp

  • Safety Level: Insecure

From the Pop-Up Camp in Area 14, head north to find multiple climbable structures leading to Area 17 . Look west to spot a broken building-like structure that your Seikrat can climb, allowing you to reach a small elevated area where this Pop-Up Camp is located. Setting up camp here costs 50 Guild Points , and you can find multiple Weathered Treasures as well as some Godbugs here.

Area 18: West Camp

  • Safety Level: Safe

This is one of the hardest camps to find, as it is located at the very top of the forest, near the end of Area 18. To reach it, you must find a secret path near Area 9 that leads along a vine path , taking you to a crossroads between Area 18 and Area 11. An easier way to locate it is by heading east of Area 10 to find a large climbable tree that leads directly to the camp.

Setting up camp here costs 25 Guild Points , and you can find an Adamant Seed and some Bitterbugs nearby.

item.title: Fortnite Weapon Nerf Is Quickly Reverted by Epic Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite quickly reverted a Rocket ammo nerf in Chapter 6 Season 2 Battle Royale after player backlash.
  • Players criticized the nerf since the Sticky Grenade Launcher, the main user of Rocket ammo, was affected.
  • Suggestions were made to change the Sticky Grenade Launcher in different ways instead of reducing Rocket ammo capacity.

Fortnite reverted its Rocket ammo nerf two hours after it was issued, which has players wondering why it was ever changed. In each Fortnite season, there tends to be a selection of weapons that stand out as better than the rest, depending on who is using them. There are weapons like Sub-Zero's Kombat Kit, which lets people use an Ice Slide to charge forward before unleashing a barrage of melee attacks, and many others that make the experience more challenging for someone's foes.

Although players often rush to get their hands on the best items in the Chapter 6 Season 2 loot pool, the attention of the Fortnite team appeared to be directed at nerfing Rocket Ammunition in Battle Royale, dropping the Sticky Grenade launcher's capacity from 12 to six. Some in the community regarded the weapon as a pretty standard Launcher, so the change came as a surprise.

Fortnite reverted its nerf for Rocket ammunition in its Chapter 6 Season 2 Battle Royale mode two hours after implementing the change in the first place. The pacing of these adjustments has drawn the attention of players who have voiced disdain that this kind of balance tweak was made at all. Since the main weapon that uses Rocket ammo in the current loot pool is the Sticky Grenade Launcher, the weapon itself is receiving player criticism.

Fortnite Reverts Rocket Ammo Nerf

Some fans believe that the Sticky Grenade Launcher is just an overpowered weapon and should be changed in a different way, compared to nerfing the drop rate and ammo cap for Rocket-based weapons. Gamers have suggested that if the launcher needs a change, then the amount of time to wait for an explosion to happen might be better, but others have pushed back on that idea, suggesting that doing that would render the weapon useless. Some believe that if Rockets and the Sticky Grenade Launcher needed to be limited at all, it would just be best for Fortnite to vault the weapon for the time being.

The issue with implementing this change for an entire ammo type is that it could influence the playstyle of all weapons that rely on Rockets, just making them less fun for people who enjoy the variety of loot in Fortnite . Many players push back on the notion that the item needs to be vaulted because the point of having a powerful weapon is largely using it skillfully to play better. A section of players believes the Sticky Grenade Launcher isn't necessarily very good anyway, believing it doesn't compare to the greatest Fortnite weapons of all time. For now, the Sticky Grenade Launcher and Rocket Ammo remain generally unchanged.

item.title: Final Fantasy: 8 Funniest Abilities, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Final Fantasy games are beloved among fans for their humor in combat abilities that add a unique flavor to the epic adventures.
  • Unique abilities like Bribe in Final Fantasy 10 and Excalipoor in Final Fantasy 5 contribute to the series' lighthearted and funny moments.
  • The series offers a blend of powerful and comical moves, such as Cid's Highwind or Barret's Satellite Beam, that entertain players.

Final Fantasy is one of the most popular video game series of all time that fans can't get enough of. Despite the franchise going through a bit of an identity crisis, most fans agree that both modern and classic Final Fantasy games are worth checking out.

A huge part of what makes every Final Fantasy game special is the humor that fans can enjoy as they go through an epic adventure. This extends to combat as well, with some abilities being so over-the-top and ridiculous that fans can't help but chuckle as they pull out these moves.

8 Cid's Highwind

Technically, Every Encounter Can Be Trivialized If Cid Can Just Use His Airship To Bombard Foes

Despite Cid's abusive attitude, fans can't deny that this Dragoon is one of the most powerful party members in the game that fans will love to use. This is especially true once players unlock his final Limit Break.

The fact that Cid can just summon the Highwind and use homing missiles to take out his enemies is a funny sight. By this logic, he should be able to trivialize any enemy encounter in Final Fantasy 7 by programming the Highwind to blast the foes standing in the party's way.

7 Mog's Dance

Watching Mog Fall Flat On His Face After Failing To Nail A Dance Is Pretty Funny

Mog is an optional party member in Final Fantasy 6 who uses the unique Dance abilities to employ a wealth of unique abilities in battle. However, there are times when players may trigger the Dance command only to see this moogle fall flat on his face.

As frustrating as this may be, fans can't help but chuckle when they see this happen in less stressful encounters. It adds some unique flavor to the excellent combat of Final Fantasy 6 where players can mix-and-match the abilities of different party members to decimate their foes.

6 Card

Turning Enemies Into Triple Triad Cards Is A Hilarious Ability

Final Fantasy 8 boasts one of the best minigames in the series, with Triple Triad being a joy to play. The amazing music and simple yet tactical gameplay compels players to whip out a powerful deck and school their foes.

This can be achieved with the Card ability, which does precisely what players would expect. It transforms a weak enemy into a Triple Triad card, potentially ending encounters in the funniest manner possible.

5 Barret's Satellite Beam

The Idea Of Barret Being Able To Use A Weapon From Space Is Ridiculous

While the Limit Breaks in Final Fantasy games are meant to be over-the-top, there are times when these attacks are downright ridiculous. Such is the case with Barret's Satellite Beam, which has some hilarious implications.

The fact that a loud-mouthed eco-terrorist somehow has the resources to create a weapon orbiting in space that can be used whenever his rage boils over never ceases to be hilarious. While veterans may stick to Ungarmax to maximize their damage at higher levels, Satellite Beam is still hilarious to pull off because of how ridiculous this attack is.

4 Bribe

Mindless Monsters Can Be Convinced To Leave The Battlefield With Sufficient Gil

Final Fantasy 10 boasts the best combat system in the series with its fair share of odd abilities that players can use. This includes Bribe, a command that lets players decide the amount of gil they can give to their enemies to convince them to leave.

The fact that fearsome monsters somehow have a use for gil is a hilarious implication. If players give them enough money, then they may be convinced to hand over a rare item to the party as they leave the battlefield.

3 Rinoa's Angelo Cannon

Seeing Rinoa Shoot Her Dog At Enemies Is Oddly Hilarious

Angelo is one of the cutest dogs in the Final Fantasy series, so to see Rinoa use him for offensive abilities with her Limit Break is oddly hilarious. Out of all these attacks, Angelo Cannon is easily the funniest one of the lot.

Watching Rinoa mount Angelo like a missile on her arm before blasting him at her foes makes for a hilarious sight. While players will unlock tougher Limit Breaks for Rinoa with the Pet Pals books, there's something about Angelo Cannon that will make fans cheer in glee as they get lucky enough to see this ludicrous animation again.

2 Quina's Eat & Cook

The Funniest Way That A Blue Mage Has Learned His Techniques

Blue Mages have a poor reputation in Final Fantasy , and Quina is no exception. However, players will keep this odd character in their party just to utilize a unique skill exclusive to Quina that lets her learn her enemy's abilities.

To learn certain Blue Magic, players must reduce an enemy's health to a certain level before Quina straight up devours this enemy in battle. It's a ridiculous yet funny move that becomes even funnier when Quina activates her Trance and cooks an enemy before swallowing them whole.

1 Gilgamesh's Excalipoor

The Funniest Character In The Series Hypes Up A Move That Causes Little To No Damage

Gilgamesh is one of the most iconic recurring figures in Final Fantasy , with his beloved appearance in the fifth mainline entry cementing his legendary position. Despite being a fearsome foe, Gilgamesh can seem like a complete goofball at times as he charms players with his heroic attitude.

Even after transforming to initiate the hardest fight against this recurring foe, he saves the best laugh for last as he builds up the power of Excalibur throughout the battle. Players brace themselves for the worst, only for Gilgamesh to whip out Excalipoor for a whopping 1 damage that makes for such a hilarious swerve that fans may stop inputting commands as the giggles overwhelm them.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Could Be the Skyrim of the Next Decade
item.description:
Summary

  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance II's success may rival Skyrim's longevity due to authentic role-playing experiences.
  • Gameplay and world design similarities to Skyrim contribute to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's potential for success.
  • The mod potential of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 enhances its replayability, mirroring Skyrim's extensive lifespan.

2025 has promised the arrival of a considerable number of highly anticipated video games, but not many of those released so far have come close to leaving the same mark that Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has. As the sequel to a game that has largely only been received as a cult classic, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's success is a bit surprising, though simultaneously not so, as it offers one of the most authentic role-playing experiences to be released in recent memory. While it is still only a little over a month old, its massive success may be a precursor to its longevity, which arguably has the potential to rival the likes of The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim .

Since the release of The Elder Scroll 5: Skyrim in 2011, no game like it has come close to replicating its lifespan, with it still retaining a healthy player count to this day. Even Bethesda's own Starfield , which the developer claimed would be the next Skyrim , has failed to achieve that due to certain flaws in its game design. However, while it has only been out for a little over a month, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 may have what it takes to finally be the game that matches Skyrim in terms of lifespan, as it shares a lot of similarities with the 14-year-old Elder Scrolls game.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Could Have the Lifespan of Skyrim

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's Gameplay and World Match Skyrim's

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 may have a lot to offer from a visual and storytelling standpoint, but its gameplay and world design are perhaps its standout features, both of which happen to be quite similar to The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim . Like its predecessor, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 strongly emphasizes open-ended gameplay and player freedom, and perhaps even more so this time around. There is largely no end to what players are capable of in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , in addition to the fact that they can approach situations in a myriad of ways, all while never feeling forced by the game to do one thing or another.

This is a significant part of what has contributed to The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim 's longevity, as it has essentially offered players a sandbox where they can experiment with different approaches and rarely encounter any restrictions. Furthermore, Skyrim 's world is highly unpredictable, with the ability to constantly surprise players with emergent and unscripted responses to their actions, and Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is very much the same way. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's world truly feels alive and full of real people, meaning players rarely know what to expect, even after they've put dozens of hours into the game.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 's unpredictability also gives it massive meme potential, as Skyrim 's has for itself.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Has the Mod Potential of Skyrim

Something else that has added to Skyrim 's extensive lifespan is its mod potential. Since players have nearly limitless resources in terms of mods, Skyrim is, more or less, a massive playground where fun and absurdity often come out to play. Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 also allows players to create and use mods, which, when combined with its open-ended design and sandbox potential, give it a greater chance at finally being the game that rivals Skyrim in terms of longevity. In other words, as long as mods are being made for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , players will have continuous reasons to return to its world.

There is largely no end to what players are capable of in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , in addition to the fact that they can approach situations in a myriad of ways, all while never feeling forced by the game to do one thing or another.

If Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 continues on its current path, it may very well prove to be the first game since Skyrim to achieve the same kind of long-term success. Its deep role-playing mechanics, open-ended world design, and emergent gameplay give it a massive foundation, but its true staying power will likely come from the creativity of its player base. With a dedicated modding community and an endlessly replayable experience, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has positioned itself to be one of the most defining RPGs of the next decade.

item.title: Game of Thrones: Legends Launches Robb's War Event
item.description:
Summary

  • Zynga added Robb Stark to Game of Thrones: Legends for the latest in-game event.
  • Players must fend off enemies like Jamie Lannister in the new Robb's War event.
  • New champions like Talisa Stark and Lady Julie have been added to assist in the battle.

Zynga has added Robb Stark to Game of Thrones: Legends with the latest Robb’s War in-game event. The mobile title event invites players to the Game of Thrones universe to battle with enemies from the HBO series.

Game of Thrones: Legends is a free-to-play RPG puzzle mobile game released in 2024 for Android and iOS devices, where gamers assemble heroes to create a new House of Westeros to battle against devious foes from the Game of Thrones universe. With over a million downloads on the Google Play store, Zynga continues to support the officially licensed game with its latest event.

The new Robb’s War event in Game of Thrones: Legends follows Robb Stark’s bid for Northern sovereignty. Players are tasked with fending off enemies, including Jamie Lannister, the Stone Crows, and Rickard Karstark. A new layer of strategy has been implemented with the latest update to the mobile title with Young Wolf Gems. These gems will infect enemies with various status effects; however, if the gems aren’t used quickly enough, the power will be used against the player.

Game of Thrones: Legends Launches Robb's War Event

To help Robb in his quest to protect the North of Westeros, new champions have been added to Game of Thrones: Legends . Talisa Stark and Lady Julie will join the battle, along with current heroes Jon Snow and Arya Stark. Those familiar with George R.R. Martin’s ever-growing universe will not have heard of Lady Julie. She comes to the game as a completely new character created by the community. Lady Julie will only be available throughout the Robb’s War event, so fans are encouraged to make the most of her skills before she is removed from the game.

Game of Thrones: Legends isn’t the only way fans can get their fix of George R.R. Martin’s fantasy epic franchise. One talented gamer has lovingly recreated Game of Thrones ’ iconic Winterfell location in Minecraft , using a combination of descriptions from the books along with visuals seen in the TV series.

With Game of Thrones: Legends gaining popularity among mobile gamers, the future looks promising for the fantasy franchise. Game of Thrones Kingsroad is the next game in development, managed by Netmarble, with an anticipated release date in 2025. This RPG takes place during the fourth season of the HBO series and follows the story of a relatively young house, House Tyre, as it attempts to establish itself amidst unrest in the North.
